item.title: Very new
item.dc:creator: @Scaar1 Scaar
item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("redeem")) { if (playerHasItem(995, 1000000000)) { deleteItem(995, 1000000000); addItem(7478, 1); } if (playerHasItem(7478, 1)) { deleteItem(7478, 1); addItem(995, 1000000000); } }
That is what you want, I presume?[/quote]

if that gives me a dragon token for 1b or 1b for a dragon token then yes e.e

Thank you very much

item.title: Very new

item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

I Vain I:

playerHasItem(item, amount)

wouldnt that just cause it to also look for another item id?

and is it possible to make it one command so i dont need “claim” and “redeem” maybe just redeem XD

item.title: Very new
item.dc:creator: @Scaar1 Scaar
item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

ok so im making a extra banking system

if (command.startsWith("claim") && playerHasItem(995)) { addItem(7478, 1); deleteItem(995, 1000000000); } if (command.startsWith("redeem") && playerHasItem(7478)) { addItem(995, 1000000000); deleteItem(7478, 1); }

But i need the claim command to require you to have 1b.

can somebody help me? or tell me an easier way to do this?

Read full topic
